They are currently used only as a helper. \n That is - when you want to enter a new word via "Add New Words" screen, once you click on the "Translation" field you will get some possible translations, you may have wanted to use.\n This saves you time, you really don\'t want to spend on just switching the keyboard from one language to the other.
just click on the \"Settings\" button below and pick a language you want to learn there. Then just click the \"Back\" button and you are ready to go.

This app allows you to learn the words even if you think that you are just too lazy to do it. 

 The method, used by LearnIt is simple. 

 Once you have added new words to your dictionary, they start appearing as notifications, making it impossible for you to miss them. 

 The click on a notification shows the word you would want to translate and some possible translations from which you have to pick a correct one.


The key idea is that the notifications can only be closed by picking the correct translation of the word.


This whole system makes you repeat the words you learn every day (at most), which ensures remembering the word, while putting nearly no effort in learning.
 Basically, the app takes away all your responsibility to learn 5 or 10 new words every day. It works for me, anyway.

Recently I have added the external offline dictionaries support. They are currently used only as a helper for guessing translations you wanted to enter. 


That is - when you want to enter a new word via "Add New Words" screen, once you click on the "Translation" field you will get some possible translations, you may have wanted to use.


This saves you time, you really don't want to spend on just switching the keyboard from one language to the other.

To use the dictionary currently you would have to download and put it into your phone's memory manually as I have still not developed any way to do that automatically.

 The dictionaries should be put in the sd card, in the folder "LearnIt" (you may want to click "export dictionary" inside the app - this will create the folder automatically) If you have any ideas, I would love to hear them.

 The dictionaries should be put in the folder {language_from}-{language_to}. 

 StarDict usually is distributed with 3 files *.ifo, *.idx, *.dict. They all have to have name "dict".

 So for German-English dict the path looks as follows:

 /SD_CARD/LearnIt/de-en/dict.ifo
 /SD_CARD/LearnIt/de-en/dict.idx
 /SD_CARD/LearnIt/de-en/dict.dict
While you are on "Dictionary" screen, and you have some words from your dictionary showing in the list, you may long-click them and edit/delete them.\n

While this application is just my hobby project it really means a lot for me, that people use it. If you have any feedback or suggestions, feel free to contact me and tell what you think. It is really very important for me.\n
